Luisette is a young woman, 33 years old, and a mother with a family. She opened a restaurant and has been running it for fifteen years in a local district. Her seniority, strong experience, and savoir-faire in this domain, as well as her practical prices, have enabled her to acquire a loyal customer base. 

Her small capital fund does not allow her manage her customers because of continual inventory shortages, since she make purchases in small amounts, thus the importance of this loan. This loan will enable her to purchase food supplies in large amounts (a sack of rice, a sack of beans, a container of oil, a sack of spaghetti…), and this will increase her sales and therefore her profits. 

She will save part of the profits she will obtain in order to expand her business. The rest will help her to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies (rice, beans, oil, spaghetti,...) for her restaurant

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es: Abigail de 61 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a dos hijos y un nieto menor de edad, quienes son su compañía. Él se dedica a sembrar maíz, maicillo y frijoles, granos básicos que tiene gran demanda en el país por lo que es un negocio muy estable, así mismo cría ganado de engorde que posteriormente vende con distintos cliente, lo que le permite contar con ganancias extras que son de mucho beneficio para su hogar. Abigail solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz para sembrar y abono, con esto él aprovechara al máximo sus recursos y sembrar mucho más para esta temporada y así obtener más ganancias y hacer crecer la cantidad de cultivo, aprovechando al máximo su parcela.
texts.en: Abigail is 61 years old, single and lives with his two sons and small grandson, which are his company.  He grows corn, beans and sorghum, basic grains that have a high demand in the country, which makes his business very stable.  He also raises cattle, which he fattens up and later sells to various customers, this allows him to count on additional income which is very helpful for his home.  Abigail is requesting a loan to be able to buy corn for planting and fertilizer, this way he can take full advantage of his resources and plant much more this season and therefore obtain more income and grow the size of his harvest taking advantage of his parcel.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and corn for planting.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica de 48 años vive junto a dos hijos y su pequeño nieto de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la agricultura de maíz y frijoles un trabajo muy duro que logra sacar adelante junto a sus dos hijos. Angélica es una persona muy conocida en la zona por ser trabajadora y responsable y cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que es muy amable y atenta con sus vecinos. Angélica vela por el bienestar de su hogar, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para la compra de pesticidas, abono, semillas de maíz y frijoles con lo que pueda mejorar sus ganancias las cuales son de mucho beneficio para el sostenimiento de su hogar y su familia ya que todos dependen de este trabajo.
texts.en:
Angélica is 48 years old and lives with her two children and her six-year-old grandson. Angélica grows and sells corn and beans for a living. It is not an easy job, but it helps her and her family get ahead. Angélica is well-known in her community because she is hard-working, responsible, and highly thought of by her neighbors. She is a friendly, attentive woman who watches over the interests of her home. 

Angélica is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy pesticides, fertilizer, and seeds to grow corn and beans. She hopes to increase her earnings from this work in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a business selling dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Elena has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 28 years old, a married man and has one child who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who strives to offer his family a good life. He has been operating a home appliances business for five years. He started his business from his personal capital. It is the main source of his income. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish. Due to the current, bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with more products of home appliances so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for his business.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.fr: Nicolas est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Nicolas a peu fréquenté l’école. Nicolas est marié à Clarisse, une couturière. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Nicolas vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Nicolas mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la peinture et la décoration dans son atelier. Nicolas s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nicolas sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 41 years old and lives in Benin.  He only attended school for a short period of time.  He is married to Clarisse, a seamstress.  They have five children in their care, some of whom go to school.  Four of these children are their own children.  Nicolas lives with his wife and children and takes care of the household expenses with his wife.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Nicolas has been working as a painter/decorator for about 20 years, in his shop.  He buys his supplies in a city in Benin and in his own region.  

In order to satisfy the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover and income, he is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  This loan will surely help him to boost his level of activity and to increase his profits.  His previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy ink and paints for plexiglass.

loans.name: Oussou Jean

texts.fr: Oussou Jean est âgé de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Oussou Jean a peu fréquenté l’école. Oussou Jean est marié à Elène, une marchande. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. En lus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Oussou Jean vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Oussou Jean mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la mécanique dans une région du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Oussou Jean vend des moutons et des boissons. Oussou Jean s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Oussou Jean sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Oussou Jean is 34 years old and lives in Benin. He has had little schooling. He is married to Elène, a merchant. The couple support five children, all in school. In addition to their children, the couple have two other children to support. Oussou Jean lives together with his wife and his children and, along with his wife, jointly ensures that household expenses are covered.

To make sure that the diverse family expenses are met, Oussou Jean has been working as a mechanic for about twenty years in a region in Benin. Parallel to this business, he sells sheep and beverages. He gets his supplies from his region.

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and his revenues, Oussou Jean is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a fourth time. This loan will surely enable him to boost his business and to make more profit. The previous loans have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and some beverages

loans.name: Juliana Modoukpè

texts.fr: Juliana Modoukpè est âgée de 44ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 20ans et 15ans. Elle vend des fournitures scolaires et des tissus depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le bénéfice généré par ce crédit lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Juliana Modoukpè is 44 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all in school. The oldest and the youngest are 20 and 15 years old, respectively. Juliana has been selling school supplies and cloth for a few years and gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about increasing her capital and satisfying the demands of her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. The profits generated from this loan will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, Bics, pencils, and cloth to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old and has six children. She is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Norma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. Norma has been raising pigs for ten years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Nounassou Anatole

texts.fr: Nounassou Anatole est âgé de 57 ans et vit au Bénin. Nounassou Anatole a peu fréquenté l’école. Nounassou Anatole est marié à Akpoton, une marchande. Le couple a six enfants dont cinq restent à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Nounassou Anatole vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Nounassou Anatole mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d’année, l’élevage des volailles. Parallèlement à cette activité, Nounassou Anatole vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, des charbons de bois et des fagots. Nounassou Anatole s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nounassou Anatole sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Nounassou Anatole is 57 years old and lives in Benin. He has had little schooling. He is married to Akpoton, a merchant. The couple have six children, of whom five remain in their care, but all six have education. Nounassou Anatole lives together with his wife and his children and, along with his wife, jointly ensures that household expenses are covered.

To make sure that the diverse family expenses are met, Nounassou Anatole has been raising poultry for about fifteen years. Parallel to this business, he sells corn, cassava flour, charcoal, and firewood. He gets his supplies from regions in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy his customers and to increase his sales and his revenues, Nounassou Anatole is requesting a loan from ALIDé for a third time. This loan will surely enable him to boost his business and to make more profit. The previous loans have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to purchase corn and cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Élie

texts.fr: Élie est âgé de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Élie a peu fréquenté l’école. Élie est marié à Justine, une coiffeuse. Le couple a un enfant. Élie vit ensemble avec sa femme et son enfant et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Élie mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la décoration dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Élie vend des graviers. Élie s’approvisionne dans des villes du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Élie sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Élie is 27 years old and lives in Benin. He only attended school for a short period of time. He is married to Justine, a hairdresser, with whom he has one child.  Élie lives with his wife and his child and takes care of the household expenses with his wife.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Élie has been working as a decorator for about 10 years, in his own region.  Additionally, he sells gravel. He stocks up in cities in Benin.

In order to satisfy the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover and income, he is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will surely help him to boost his level of activity and to increase his profits. His previous loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy plexiglass.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elvie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Elvie is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance for her fishing boat.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance for her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio continua con su negocio de carpintería el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio elabora diversos trabajos como camas, armarios, estantes entre otros, el socio es una persona resposanble y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio trabaja a pedido dependiendo lo que le soliciten sus clientes.
El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera para su negocio.

El socio se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
This is one of the members of Hatunchaskas, a Communal Bank located in the Cusco district, province and department.

He keeps on working as a carpenter. He has been engaged in his activity for a few years and things are going well thanks to the dedication he daily works with. He creates different articles such as beds, wardrobes and bookcases among others. He is a responsible and persevering person, as through this activity he provides for his family. He works by order according to what his customers request.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood for his activity.

He commits to complying with the repayments of his dues.

loans.use: To buy wood for his activity.

loans.name: Felicetas

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Felicetas works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felicetas is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Felicetas has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lie

texts.en:
Lie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business. Lie has been in this business for 10 years. Lie earns additional income from her general store and by raising pigs.

Lie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Norita has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Norita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Santiago Armando

texts.es: Santiago de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a dos hijos menores de edad. Santiago se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, los cuales son dos de los principales alimentos de este país. Él  reside en una zona rural donde muchas personas se dedican al mismo oficio, ya que la tierra es fértil y apta para este tipo de actividad,  por lo que él debe esforzarse al máximo por brindar calidad en sus productos y de esta forma contar con clientes satisfechos. Es por esta razón que Santiago solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar palas, arados, abono, pesticidas y semillas de frijoles y maíz para sembrar. De esta forma espera aumentar su producción de granos básicos para posteriormente vender  por  mayor, actividad a la cual su esposa le ayuda. El préstamo otorgado por INTEGRAL, es muy importante para el crecimiento de su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en: Santiago is 42 years old and lives with his wife, who is a homemaker, and their two young children. Santiago works growing corn and beans, which are the two main food staples of this country.  He lives in a rural area where many people are also dedicated to this same work as the land is fertile and suitable for these crops.  He must make every effort to provide quality products to keep his customers satisfied.  Santiago is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy shovels, plows, fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to plant beans and corn. This way he hopes to increase grain production to later sell wholesale, with which his wife will help.  The loan granted by INTEGRAL is very important not only for the growth of his business but also the economic stability of his home.

loans.use: to buy plows and shovels for agriculture.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica sigue con la misma actividad de venta de comida en su puetso de venta que se encuentran en la zona de Tembladerani, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior credito y en esta ocacion necesita el credito para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideo y aceite para la elaboracion de sus riquisimos platillos.
texts.en: Veronica continues with the same activity of selling food in her stall located in the Tembladerani area. She says she did well with the previous loan and this time she needs the loan to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, and oil for the elaboration of her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 28 лет. Она разведена. У нее трое детей. Зарина на протяжении десяти лет работает на рынке. На сегодняшний день она занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Зарина хочет увеличит оборот. Она просит кредит для покупки винограда, яблок, граната, груши, хурмы и огурцов.
texts.en: Zarina lives in the Khuroson region. She is 28 years old. She is divorced and has three children. For 10 years, Zarina has been working as a vendor at the market. At present she sells fruits and vegetables. Zarina would like to increase her sales volume. She is requesting a credit in order to purchase grapes, apples, pomegranates, pears, persimmons  and cucumbers.

loans.use: to purchase grapes, apples, pomegranates, pears, persimmons  and cucumbers.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her fishing business.

Rhoda has been in this business for 14 years. Rhoda earns more income from fish vending.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Cesar Bolivar

texts.es: Cesar tiene 60 años de estado civil casado, tiene 1 hijo .El empezó esta labor de recoger pomas plásticas, cartones. Por la falta de empleo que tiene el país Ecuador . Ya que nadie le dio un empleo el se fue por esta laboral y en la actualidada le bien .Con el préstamo Cesar quiere arreglar su casa etc.
texts.en: Cesar is 60 years old, is married, and has one child. She started the job of collecting plastics and cardboard for the lack of jobs that the country of Ecuador has. Because no one gave him a job, he started this job and he is doing well now. With the loan Cesar wants to fix his house, etc.

loans.use: to fix his house.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery  tiene 47 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la  administración de guardarropía,  su domicilio se encuentra en la zona de Villa Copacabana, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rosmery  solicito este préstamo para la inversión compra de mesas y sillas y adornos  para abrir un nuevo negocio que es una discoteca,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo ya que se necesita capital para este nuevo negocio, la Sra. Rosmery enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que trabajar hasta tempranas horas de la madrugada y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir invirtiendo en su segunda actividad, ya que su deseo fue siempre el de abrir una discoteca.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 47 years old. She is married and has two children, who are adults. She runs a coatroom. Her home is located in the Villa Copacabana area. 

This loan is her first with the institution. Rosemary applied for this loan in order to buy tables, chairs and decorations, so that she can open a new business which is a nightclub. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of working capital for this new business. Rosemery is facing challenges in her business such as having to work until the early hours of the morning. 

She is going to use the profits to continue investing in this, her second livelihood, as her wish was always to open a nightclub.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, in order to open a nightclub.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a recycled materials business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Soukeye

texts.fr:
La dame Soukèye, âgée de 47 ans, vit dans un petit village située à environ 7 km de la ville principale. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle s’active dans le petit commerce en vendant des œufs bouillis et cela depuis 3 ans maintenant. Soukèye est une habituée du guichet elle vient pour la cinquième fois solliciter un crédit de 100000F CFA afin de renouveler une expérience qu’elle fait chaque année : acheter des ovins à l’approche de la Tabaski, les engraisser un peu pour ensuite les revendre dans les environs.
Soukèye est mariée et avec les revenus de son activité, elle soutien son époux dans les charges familiales. Son objectif est de gagner davantage de l’argent, c’est pourquoi elle s’active dans diverses autres activités susceptibles de générer du profit.
texts.en:
Soukèye, age 47, lives in a small village located about 7 km from the main town.  She is married and has family. She is actively involved in small retail, having sold boiled eggs for the past three years.

Soukèye, a regular client of our institution, is now applying for her fifth loan.  This new loan of 100,000 CFA francs will help her to accomplish something that she does every year: before the Tabaski celebration [known elsewhere in the Muslim world as Eid-al-Adha], she buys sheep for fattening and local resale.

Soukèye is married and, thanks to the income generated from her activity, she helps her husband cover the family expenses.  Her goal is to make more money.  This is why she is actively involved in various other income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale, and to continue to sell boiled eggs.

loans.name: Jaqueline Concepcion

texts.es: Jaqueline de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos. Desde que salió de su embarazo ella quiso retomar su trabajo pero como no sabía con quien dejar a su hijos pues  fue ahí entonces que su esposo le puso un negocio de artesanía pues ella hace pulsera y las vende también vende ropa y variedades un mini bazar .Su sueño es arreglar su casa pues ya la tiene es de caña y ella quiere una de cemento. Con el préstamo ella va a comprar ropa,  papeles, cuadernos y tambien materiale para hacer pulsera etc.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is married and has two children, After her pregnancy, she wanted to return to work but didn't know with whom to leave her children. Then, her husband provided her with a craft business, because she makes bracelets and she also sells clothes and varieties, it's like a mini bazaar. 

Her dream is to fix her house because the one she has is made of cane and she wants one of cement. With the loan she will buy clothes, papers, notebooks, and also material to make bracelets.

loans.use: to buy clothes, papers, notebooks and also material to make bracelets.

loans.name: Dossou Mathias

texts.fr: Dossou Mathias est âgé de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Dossou Mathias a peu fréquenté l’école. Dossou Mathias est marié à Jeanne, une photographe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Dossou Mathias vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec sa femme, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Dossou Mathias mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, la peinture et la décoration dans sa région. Dossou Mathias s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Dossou Mathias sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dossou Mathias is 45 years old and lives in Benin. He only attended school for a short period of time. He is married to Jeanne, a photographer, with whom he has two children who attend school. Dossou Mathias lives with his wife and his children and takes care of the household expenses with his wife.

In order to cover the various family expenses, Dossou Mathias has been working as a painter/decorator for about 30 years, in his own region. He buys his supplies in a city in Benin and also in Togo.

In order to satisfy the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover and income, he is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will surely help him to boost his level of activity and to increase his profits. His previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy plexiglass, paints and ink.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es: El Sr. Primitivo tiene 56 años y es casado con 4 hijos que son  ya mayores e independientes, ella se dedica a la confección de trajes y arreglo de algunas prendas de vestir, ya que el Sr. Es sastre su sastrería se encuentran en la zona de Yunguyo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución y va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de máquina de coser recta ya que será de gran ayuda para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es  mejorar su capital  de trabajo el Sr. Primitivo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar la producción en costura y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de tela e hilos y así ir mejorando en su negocio, el Sr. Primitivo se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 56 years old, is married and has four children, who are adults and independents. He is dedicated to make suits and arrangements for some clothing. He is a tailor and his tailor's shop is located in the Yunguyo area. 

This loan is his first sequence in the institution and he will use the loan to buy a straight sewing machine because that will be very useful for his business. His reason to apply for a loan is to improve his working capital. Primitivo faces challenges in his business, such as to increase production in sewing. He will use the benefits to buy fabric and thread so he will improve his business. Primitivo is happy for the opportunity given.

loans.use: to buy a straight sewing machine.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11000 PHP through NWTF to buy grocery items such as chips, eggs, soap, etc. for her business to sell.

Crisanta has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from fruit vending.

Crisanta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as chips, eggs, soap, etc. for her business to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old, married, and has five children. Two of her children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business of farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines. Merlinda requested an 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

Merlinda has been farming rice and sugarcane for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 44 years old, married and has two children.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Myrna has been raising livestock for nine years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime, se dedica a la venta de queso y de crema, tiene 34 años de edad vive con su esposa quien trabaja como enfermera, el tiene dos años dedicándose a la venta de queso crema, distribuye a los puestos por mayor, tiene ya su zona bien definidas, trabaja de lunes a sábado.

Actualmente se le presenta la oportunidad de comprar un lote de queso y crema para eso solicita un préstamo que le facilite los recursos económicos y que él pueda realizar una buena inversión para incrementar el inventario y poder así continuar distribuyendo sus clientes los lácteos.

El objetivo de Jaime es fortalecer el negocio aprovechando de préstamos, ya que esto le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y tener más capacidad para emplearse en la zona que atiende, asi mismo poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime sells cheese and cream. He is 34, and lives with his wife, who works as a nurse. He has two years of experience selling cheese and cream. He distributes to vendor stands at wholesale, and already has a well-defined sales area. He works from Monday to Saturday. 

Currently he has the opportunity to buy a batch of cheese and cream, and that is why he is applying for a loan that will provide him with the financial resources so that he can undertake a good investment to increase his inventory. This way he will be able to continue distributing dairy products to his customers. 

Jaime's objective is to build up his business by taking advantage of the loans. This will allow him to increase his sales, have more capacity to put to use in the area he serves, and also provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 34 years old. She is married and has two children.
Salvacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional products for her business.
Salvacion has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and she also earns income from charcoal sales, sound system rentals, and Avon products sales.
Salvacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery products for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and married with six children. Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, sugar, and other miscellaneous items for her store.

Elsa has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising livestock.

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like soap, shampoo, sugar, and other miscellaneous items for her store.

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her two children.

Ethel requested a 4600 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses and have a backup light in case of emergency. Ethel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Lilia requested a loan of 11000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna, age 25, lives with her spouse and two children in a suburban neighborhood in Kisauni. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last four months. She has a sales stand in a market in the city where she sells kale, tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, and onions, amongst others, at retail prices. Anna also sells charcoal from the same location. In order to stock up, she needs a 10,000 KES loan to buy items including kale, tomatoes, and cabbage. She hopes to increase sales and income to support her children’s schooling and to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy items including kale, tomatoes, and cabbage.

loans.name: Ndèye Maty

texts.fr:
Agée de 29 ans, madame Ndèye Maty fait du commerce de tissus depuis plus de 4 ans. Elle se voue corps et âme dans son métier, elle y passe la journée. Elle est mariée et mère de famille ; elle  adore ses enfants et fait tout ce qui est possible pour les satisfaire.
Elle vient solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter des tissus et des draps de lits pour les revendre. Ndèye Maty s’occupe de la scolarité de ses enfants et appuie son mari dans les dépenses de la maison. Grace au crédit, elle arrive à épargner un peu d’argent dans le but d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ces enfants et à leur éducation.
texts.en:
Ndèye Maty, age 29, has been selling fabrics for more than four years.  She is completely dedicated to her activity and works all day long.  She is married and has a family.  She adores her children and always does her best to satisfy their needs.

She has applied for a loan of 150,000 CFA francs to buy fabrics and bedsheets for resale.  She takes care of her children's school fees and helps her husband with the household expenses.

Through credit, she is able to save some money.  Her goal is to improve her children's living conditions and to educate them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and bedsheets for resale.

loans.name: Heidi Roxana

texts.es: Heidi tiene 26 años de edad  ,Heidi confecciona manualidades las cuales vende en su domicilio. Ella nos cuenta que empezó el negocio traveseando, es decir que cortaba moldes y hacia experimentos con ellos, poco a poco le fue gustando por lo empezó varios cursos e hizo de esto su negocio. Al principio se le hizo difícil ya que tenía que promocionar para crear su cartera de clientes. Hace 5 años que inicio el negocio y ahora le va muy bien trabajando todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde ya que tiene otro trabajo. Como es madre soltera tiene 2 trabajos y gracias a eso y al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha salido adelante hasta la fecha. Heidi nos comenta que una de sus dificultades es la ubicación ya que quisiera poder ubicarlo en la parte exterior de su casa, abriendo un local amplio donde pueda exhibir las manualidades que realiza. Con el crédito comprara material para la confección como fomix, telas, lanas, hilos y demás. Espera continuar trabajando para seguir apoyando a su hijo y que siga adelante en la profesión que elija.
texts.en: Heidi is 26 years old. She creates handicrafts which she sells from her home. She reports that she started this business gradually; that is to say, she cut out patterns and experimented with them, and she began to enjoy it more and more, so she started to take various courses and made a business out of it. At the beginning it was difficult for her because she had to promote herself to build up a network of customers. It was five years ago that she started her business, and it is now going very well for her. She works every day from 9 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon, since she has another job. Since she is a single mother, she has 2 jobs, and thanks to this and to the effort she puts into her work, she has been able to make progress up to now. Heidi comments that one of her difficulties is her location, because she would like to locate her business in the outside area of her home, opening a sizable store where she can exhibit the crafts she makes. With the loan she will buy materials to make her products, such as foamboard, fabrics, thread and other items. She hopes to continue working so that she can keep supporting her son and get ahead in the profession she has chosen.

loans.use: to buy foamboard, fabrics, wool and thread.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 19000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in the store. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Almaya Group

texts.en:
This group is called Almaya and consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Hakima is a 31-year-old married woman and has five children. Her educational background is secondary school and she has a house.

Hakima is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase paint for her house. She aspires to improve living conditions for her family. 

Hakima is aiming to have a business store. This will help her gain more profits so she will have the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole, and have big house.

loans.use: to purchase paint for her house.

loans.name: Citas

texts.en:
Citas is 58 years old and married with four children.

Citas works hard to provide for her family. She runs a vehicle spare parts business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional spare parts to sell.

Citas has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spare parts business for 1 year and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Citas aspires to save money for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Al-Mostgbl Group

texts.en:
This is a group with initiative, values, and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called "Al-Mostgbl" and consists of three women and one man. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. They are each interested in developing their business. They requested a loan of 130000 YER.

Suhair is the group leader. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her business is embroidery, ladies' clothes, bags, and children's clothes. This has been her sole source of income for over five years. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighbourhood.

With the income from her business she could improve her home and enjoy more comfort. At the present time, her business doesn't get her more profits due to the bad situation in Yemen. She applied for a loan of 30000 YER from AMB to acquire articles for embroidery, such as needles and thread, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her business income.

In the future she would like to expand her business to open manual labor stores.

loans.use: to acquire articles for embroidery, such as needles and thread, for her business.

loans.name: Adelaida Maribel

texts.es: Adelaida tiene 32 años estado civil soltera,  no tiene hijo. Adelaida Cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró y a raíz que su ex esposo la abandono ella tuvo que luchar para llevar el pan de cada día  a su hogar por eso Adelaida  desde ese entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos
texts.en: Adelaida is 32 years old and single.  She has no children.  Adelaida began selling cosmetics due to the lack of employment opportunities that exist in her country.  She looked for work but was not able to find a job after her ex-husband abandoned her, and she had to fight to earn a living.  So she decided to sell cosmetics and has done very well since then.  She works at night so she can sell to her neighbors.  With this loan she would like to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorant and powders.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorant and powders.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 63 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy other farming equipment for her business.

Perla has been farming rice for 32 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy other farming equipment for her business

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 37 years old and married with 4 children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her business.

Sally has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from direct selling for personal collections.

Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household supplies and grocery stock for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, age 34, is married and has four children. Her husband works as a teacher. They do not have their own house; they rent where they live.

Salome and her husband run a private primary school. She devotes herself to the household chores. As she has a certificate in early childhood education, she also lends her services to the pupils in her school.

This is her first loan with Yehu. She will use the loan to buy books, chairs, tables, and stationery.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy books, chairs, tables, and stationery.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, 43, is married and has two children. She lives in the town of Kisauni, Kenya. She has had a home-based business for ten years where she sells bread for retail and wholesale. She works every day from Monday through Saturday. It’s a profitable business that has a regular clientele. She has kept it stable and well-stocked thanks to the support of her husband. 

Catherine needs a loan to buy stocks of breads to sell. Her goal is to increase sales and to always have a better life. She plans to expand the business and earn more income to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bread to sell.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is 27 years of age and lives with her husband and their three children. She is quite an ambitious young woman who wants to get ahead and have a better life. Some years ago, she started her own business raising chickens. She sells them to different people and businesses.
Racheal is requesting a loan to allow her to increase the quantity of chickens and to buy feed for her chickens, enabling her to offer better customer service.
Racheal wants to greatly expand her business, and she puts much effort into this goal. At her young age, she has demonstrated herself to be a very enterprising young woman with much desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ngossé

texts.fr:
Madame Ngossé, une dame de 56 ans s’active dans le commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est très brave et tout ce qu’elle endure dans le commerce sert à participer au bon développement de ses enfants et à leur épanouissement. Pour cela, elle soutient beaucoup son époux dans les charges familiales. 
Elle est à son second crédit, et vient solliciter une somme de 400000F CFA pour acheter divers produits et engraisser son cheptel pour augmenter la production de lait. Elle vend du lait caillé sur la route (comme on la voit sur la photo).
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait agrandir son activité afin de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ngossé, a 56-year old woman, has been working as a vendor for five years. She is married and has children. She is very courageous and works very hard to grow her business and provide for her children’s education and well-being. She helps her husband with a lot of family expenses.

She is on her second loan. She just requested 400,000 francs in order to buy various products and also to fatten her cattle in order to increase the production of milk. She sells curds by the roadside (as can be seen in the photo).
In the future, she would like to grow her business and maximize her revenues.

loans.use: to buy various products to resale and to fatten her cattle in order to increase the production of milk.

loans.name: Muath

texts.en:
Muath is a 29-year-old man, married and a father of three children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a barber store which has been operating for two years.

He started his business with limited capital that qualified him to open his business. He has some regular customers and is quite preferred in the zone because he always strives to offer his customers good services. He is a professional in his field.

Lately, he’s noticed that competition has become quite fierce, so he’s decided to take the situation in hand because this business is his main source of income, and he always wants to stay one step ahead of his competition.  He requested a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB. With this loan, he’ll expand his business by making decoration for his salon and buying barber supplies.

In the future, he hopes his family will attain better living conditions and that he’ll be able to maintain his business for more time.

loans.use: to make decoration for his salon and to buy barber supplies.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
For the last five years, Fridah has operated a poultry business, selling her chicken and chicken products to hotel operators and the general public. She is a single woman with two children who are attending school.

She is requesting this loan to pay school fees for her son. Fridah is a faithful woman who is sure to repay the loan as per the schedule.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 51-year-old Abu. He is married, and has 5 children aged 4, 6, 8, 10 and 15 years. All are school going children. In 1983, Abu established his assorted used clothing (Asian dresses, brassieres, pants etc.) business. He began his business because he didn't attend school; he was only introduced to farming. When he became mature, he farmed on his own and the proceeds he got were used to trade in a used clothing business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,216,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Abu has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy 5 bales of Asian dresses @ Le 900,000. In the future, Abu plans to build a house, send his children abroad and provide a quality education for them, and acquire a shop. This loan will help him to accomplish some of his future plans. Some bales sometimes may contain spoiled clothing. He is a hardworking businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for his business

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es: José Arnulfo de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro  y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alto potencial agrícola, son un suelo muy fértil, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; José es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy luchador siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido al clima y desea recuperarse pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol y maicillo, insecticida, abono, herbicida, etc. José Arnulfo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José Arnulfo, who is 40 years old, lives with his life companion and their children. He is a farmer. Specifically, he grows corn, beans, and sorghum. He has worked in this occupation for a number of years, and this has given him a lot of experience, which allows him to obtain the best harvests. His farmland is located in an area of high agricultural potential, with very fertile land. He sells everything he produces in the areas surrounding the community, and he already has many customers who prefer him for the quality, the good prices, and above all, the excellent service he provides. José is an entrepreneurial man, dedicated to his work, and very hard-working. He is always on the lookout for new opportunities that will allow him to achieve success. In the last planting season, he had some losses due to the weather, and he wants to recover, but he doesn't have sufficient capital. For this reason, he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds for corn, beans, and sorghum, insecticides, compost, herbicides, etc. José Arnulfo has good payment references and is very responsible. He affirms that he will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time he is confident that he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn, beans, and sorghum, insecticides, compost, and herbicides.

loans.name: Mamatkul

texts.ru: Маматкул проживает в городе Сарбанд. Ему 47 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Маматкул занимается производством и продажей кондитерских изделий. В этой области он 12 лет. Маматкул берет кредит для приобретения духовки и покупки продуктов с целью увеличения количества производимого продукта, чтобы расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Mamatkul lives in the city of Sarband.  He is 47 years old.  He is married.  He has two children.  Mamatkul makes and sells sweets.  He has worked in this sphere for 12 years.  Mamatkul is taking out a loan to purchase an oven and ingredients with the goal of increasing the quantity of the products he makes, in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and ingredients

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 34 años estado civil casada tiene 3 hijo. Comenzó trabajando hace ya  4 años en su propia empresa la cual es las elaboraciones de sandalias, la cual trabaja con sus hermanos .Su horario de trabajo comienza  a las 8.00am hasta 18.00pm. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio. Con el préstamo Ella va a comprar cuerina, accerona, plantilla
texts.en: Isabel is 34 years old, married, and has 3 children. She started working 4 years ago in her own business, which is in making sandals, which she works on with her siblings. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. Her wish is to expand her business. With the loan she is going to buy imitation leather, acetone, and insoles.

loans.use: to buy imitation leather, acetone, insoles

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба женщина в возрасте 30 лет имеет двоих детей.   К сожалению ее муж умер и она очень рано стала вдовой. Клиентка начинала свой бизнес с малого кредита и развивала постепенно.    Она занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды в центральном рынке.    Матлюба два раза в неделю ездит за товаром в город.    Она планирует расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы обеспечить свою семью, так как она является вдовой и ей очень трудно одной.    Это ее единственный доход. На полученный кредит она хочет закупить новый ассортимент женской и детской одежды.    Она очень признательна Арванд за то что помогает и поддерживает в трудной ситуации.
texts.en: Matluba is a 30 year old woman and has two children.  Unfortunately her husband died and she became a widow very early.  The client started her business with a small loan and has grown it gradually.  She sells women's and children's clothing at the central market.  Matluba travels twice a week to the city for products.  She plans to grow her business in order to provide for her family, since she is a widow and it is very hard for her to be alone.  This is her only source of income.  She would like to use the loan to purchase women's and children's clothing.  She is very grateful to Arvand for helping and supporting her in a difficult situation.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Saif

texts.en: Saif is a 41-year-old married man and has four children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He lives in a rented house with his family who face bad challenges in their life. He is applying for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine. He aspires to have a sewing store to gain profits so he has the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole and own a house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for personal use

loans.name: Iye Bah

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Iye Bah.  She is married, and has 2 children aged 4 and 7 years. All are school going children. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her though they are distant relatives, but are helped in attending school and they too are helping with domestic work. In 2000, Iye Bah established her food stuff (provisions and vegetables) business. She began her business because she dropped out of school in Form II, and the tribe that she came from does not value girl child education. They believe a woman's place is in her husband's house. She was a victim but she was lucky because her husband is a businessman who trained her and gave her a reasonable sum of money to start a business of her own instead of being a housewife.  Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 484,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Iye Bah has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase shrimp Maggie - 6 cartons @ Le 260,000, onions - 10 bags @ Le 90,000, Oil - 9 rubbers @ Le 160,000 and Le 100,000 will be used for transportation. In the future, Iye Bah plans to expand her business; the loan will help as she will be able to generate income. Competition is high, but with many goods she is able to lead in the market. She is committed to her business. Iye Bah needs more capital and with help of the credit service, she knows she will achieve that. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food stuff for her business

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino con 28 años un padre cuyo fin es el de brindar a sus 3 menores pequeños lo mejor, lo que no tuvo él cuenado era niño. Junto a su pareja Faustina, una mujer a la que él considera su brazo derecho, conforman un hogar donde reina la comprensión. Actualmente viven en una casa de madera que actualmente se encuentran rentando. proveniente de la serrania peruano, halló en la selva la oportunidad de crecer a base de cultivos rentables como el café y cacao donde con mucho empeño logró aprender todo lo necesario para desempeñarse independientemente desde hace 1 año rentando parcelas.
Se inicio como jornalero laborando en distintas parcelas donde le valió mucho para ganar experiencia y confianza con las personas del lugar, pues le permitió en adelante acceder al alquiler de una parcela completa para justamente sacarle el máximo provecho con el fin de cumplir el pago del mismo, admite que al inicio no fue fácil debido al cambio de clima, pero pasado el tiempo termino por adaptarse al entorno.
Uno de sus máximos deseos  es adquirir un terreno a largo plazo para poder así desempeñarse con mas confianza , pues tiene planeado también iniciar a cultivar otros productos ya sea el achiote, barbasco entre otros. Al iniciarse la temporada del cacao tiene planeado adquirir abono orgánico, almácigos y herramientas muy necesarias para desempeñar sus actividades de la mejor manera posible. Este es su segundo préstamo con el cual se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas debido a que a futuro planea solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la compra de su propia parcela. Esta muy contento con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que por su manera amable para con los demás logró ganarse la confianza que necesitaba.
Con los 1,000 soles comprará abono orgánico, así como herramientas para brindarle a sus cultivos de cacao la mejor atención posible con la finalidad de obtener una buena calidad.
texts.en:
Saturnino is 28 years old and is a father whose purpose is to provide the best for his three minor children, what he didn't have when he was a child. With his partner Faustina, a woman he considers his right arm, they form a home where understanding prevails. Now, they live in a wood house they are currently renting. From the Peruvian mountain range, he found the opportunity to grow profitable crops such as coffee and cocoa in the jungle. With much effort, he learned everything needed to work independently from one year ago by renting some plots. 

He started as a laborer working in different fields where he gained experience and trust from the local people, and that allowed him to access to rent a whole plot to precisely get the most of it so he can meet the payments. He admits that it wasn't easy at the beginning due to climate changes, but after a while he ended up adapting to the environment. 

One of his greatest long-term desires is to buy a plot so he will work with more confidence. He has also planned to start growing other products such as achiote and barbasco, among others. When the cocoa season starts, he has planned to buy organic fertilizer, copperwood and tools very necessary to carry out his activities in the best way possible. 

This is his second loan with which he commits to comply with all his installments because in the future he plans to apply for a loan to start buying his own plot. He is very happy with his partners in the communal bank because with his kindness he won the trust he needed. With the 1,000 soles he will buy organic fertilizer, as well as tools to provide to his cocoa crops with the best care possible in order to obtain good quality.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and farming tools.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mariatu. She is married and has two children, ages 8 and 10 years old. They are school-going children. She has two additional dependents, who live with her to be fostered. 

In 1999, Mariatu established her used clothing business selling under vests, bodices, knickers, children's dresses, boxers, etc. She began her business as she was not privileged to attend school and was introduced to farming. When her father died, they sold some of their father’s properties and shared the money. She used her share to start her business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 leones (SLL) every month from the business. She is a hardworking and honest businesswoman. 

Mariatu would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase under vests (3 bales @ 800,000 SLL) and bodices (4 bales @ 650,000 SLL). There are times when some bales will not be of good quality. In the future, Mariatu plans to build a house, educate her children and acquire a shop. This loan will help to increase her income. 

Mariatu thanks ARD for improving her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 46 años una mujer muy alegre y amistosa , tiene por pareja a Epifanio de 52 años con quien posee 3 hijos  Luis, Kelvin y Jhon quienes siempre están al pendiente de su madre, este lindo hogar tiene como lugar una casa de madera. Dentro de las capacidades que hallo para sacar adelante a su familia conjuntamente con Epifanio fue dedicarse de lleno al campo en donde hace 15 años produce una formidable variedad de productos dentro de los cuales están considera como los más rentables el café y cacao.
Le agrada su labor ya que es una actividad que sus padres también desempeñaban desde siempre, aunque dentro de las cosas que considera en contra es la época de lluvias debido a que sus parcelas son afectadas por riachuelos perjudicando sus plantaciones de manera considerable, es por ello que debe invertir paralelo a sus cultivos en jornaleros para realizar trabajos de excavación para evitar ser afectada como ya ocurrió  anteriormente.
Durante la época en la cual se inicia la siembra y el mantenimiento de sus cultivos preferentemente del cacao es necesario contar con todo lo necesario para finalmente obtener un resultado óptimo en cuanto a la calidad de sus productos dentro de las cuales como elemento primordial está el abono orgánico así como realizar la siembra de almácigos.
A futuro tiene pensado cultivar en sus parcelas árboles madereros y dedicarse a la reforestación de los mismos debido a que considera es posible hacer dinero con una tala responsable. Este es su segundo préstamo y desde ya se siente comprometida con el mismo para poder cumplir puntualmente con sus pagos, se siente muy contenta por la manera en cómo trabaja con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que son personas muy responsables. Con los 2,000 soles obtenidos realizara la compra de abundante abono orgánico así como el de almácigos de cacao con el cual piensa desempeñarse en la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Teodora is 46 years old. She is a very happy and amicable woman. She has a partner, Epifanio, who is 52 and with whom she has three children, Luis, Kelvin, and Jhon, who are always watching out for their mother. Their pleasant home is located in a house made of wood. Among the capabilities that she found to raise her family together with Epifanio, she dedicated herself to filling the field where for 15 years she has produced a tremendous variety of products, among which she considers coffee and cocoa the most profitable.

She likes her work, since it is an activity that her parents also always performed, although among the things that she finds difficult is the rainy season, because her parcels of land are affected by the rivulets that damage her plantings considerably. It is for that reason that she needs to invest, in parallel to her crops, in laborers to do some excavation work to avoid being affected as occurred in the past. During the period in which the planting is begun and the crops, preferably cocoa, are maintained, she needs to have everything necessary to eventually obtain an optimum result with regard to the quality of her products, among which the essential item is the organic fertilizer, as well as planting the seedlings.

In the future she has thought of growing trees for timber on her land and working on its reforestation, inasmuch as she considers it possible to make money with responsible cutting. 

This is her second loan, and she already feels obligated to make her payments punctually. She feels very happy about the way she works with her fellow members of her communal bank, since they are very responsible people. With the 2000 PEN that she will obtain, she will complete the purchase of plenty of organic compost as well as seedlings for cocoa, which she is thinking of working on in the next season.

loans.use: to buy organic compost as well as cacao seedlings

loans.name: Hamoud

texts.en:
Hamoud is 44 years old and a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where he lives with his nine children in Sana'a, Yemen. His educational background is a diploma. He is a teacher who pushes himself to be professional in his field. 

He has applied for a loan of YER 220,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is 44 years old and married, with seven children. 

She wants to start a small business making and selling rice and curry in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a cooking oven, rice,  chickens, curry powder, onions, flour, and a tin bowl. 

In the future, Peka hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' educations. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To buy a cooking oven, rice, chickens, curry powder, onions, salt, and flour.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and a personal business.  She has 1 child and has been doing this farming work for 8 years.   

Jeniffer stated what is most enjoyable about farming is seeing her hens grow lay eggs and she loves seeing them lay eggs and also the income from them. Her biggest challenge is getting enough feed for her broiler hens.  She will use this loan to construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds.

Jeniffer was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'From another Juhudi client.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'She has learnt more on animal husbandry.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Jennifer replied that she will be able to educate her child who is now in university, and she will also be able to feed her family.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jennifer owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Hadil Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hadil and is made up of four ladies. They took a loan of 140000 YER from AMB.

The president of this group is Hadia, who is 35 years old. She has 4 children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who feels happy. She has a house. 

Hadia applied for a loan of 50000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies to rebuild her house.

loans.use: buy construction materials for her house

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. Her primary income sources are eggs and crops.  She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 5 years.  

Lilian stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that she loves collecting eggs from her birds.  Her biggest challenge is getting food for her birds.  She will use the loan amount to buy poultry birds.

Lilian was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'from existing members.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'She learnt more on how to plan her finances.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Lilian replied 'She will be able to get more income and thus take her kids to school.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Lilian owns the following: 'poultry' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Prickta

texts.en:
Prickta lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and a salary job.  She has 4 children and has been doing this work for 15 years.  

Prickta stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that she loves feeding animals and more so the chickens.   Her biggest challenge is poultry diseases that sometimes can result in great losses.  The animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kipkaren, murugusi, kapsabet.'  She will use the loan to buy more poultry birds.

Prickta was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'From other nearby groups.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'She learnt the values of being together as a group.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Prickta replied 'She will be able to feed her family well, her income will also increase and thus she will be able to educate her children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Prickta owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, running water, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 14 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and a personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is: she loves her cows very much and seeing them makes her happy.  Her biggest challenge is high drug prices, more so when the animals are sick.  The animals on the farm have been given the names of Sofia and Maritat.    She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Salome was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Heard from another existing client.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Learnt about co existence with other members, leadership and loan management.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Salome replied 'By acquiring another cow she will be able to increase her asset base also the family income will go up.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Salome owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 44 years old.  He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where he lives with his nine children in Ibb, Yemen. His educational background includes a diploma. He is a teacher who strives to be a professional in his field. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: buy construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Jovenes Exitosos Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú!  El grupo Jóvenes Exitosos está conformado por 07 personas, en su mayoría varones todos  dedicados a diversos oficios; su única integrante mujer es Johanna que es la secretaria del grupo. Ella tiene 23 años es madre soltera con un hija pequeña, el trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, empezó este trabajo con la ayuda de su madre  que se dedica a lo mismo, son cerca de 2 años que trabaja con este negocio, ofreciendo diferentes productos a sus clientas; que en su mayoría amigas de su barrio y familiares. Por otro lado su trabajo es de mucha ayuda para ella porque así puede solventar sus gastos  de su hija. Con el fin de seguir mejorando su negocio ha solicitado a EDAPROSPO un nuevo préstamo que le servirá para la compra de productos como perfumes, lociones, joyería y maquillaje, en el futuro desea contar con un lugar propio donde pueda vender sus productos directamente. Johanna esta agradecida a los inversionistas KIVA que la apoyan tanto a ella como a los integrantes de su grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú! The group Jóvenes Exitosos (Successful Young People) is made up of 7 people, the majority men, all working at various jobs; its only woman member is Johanna, who is the secretary of the group. She is 23 years old and is a single mother with a small daughter; she works selling beauty products by catalog. She began this work with the help of her mother who does the same work. She has been working with this business for around 2 years, offering different products to her customers, of whom the majority are friends from her neighborhood and relatives. On the other hand, her work is of great help to her because in this way she can pay for her daughter’s expenses. 

With the aim of continuing to improve her business, she has requested a loan from EDAPROSPO, which she will use for the purchase of products like perfumes, lotions, jewelry and makeup. In the future, she hopes to have her own place where she can sell her products directly. Johanna is grateful to the KIVA investors who support her as well as the members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Jepkosgei

texts.en: Jepkosgei lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. Her primary income sources are milk, crops and a job salary. She has five children and has been doing her work for 10 years. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, Jepkosgei says she loves animals and she enjoys feeding them.
