She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Lourdes has been in this business for 26 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 53-year-old, married Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children; two of them are working and the other is still studying. They are all cooperating together wishing to enhance their life and bring added income to the family. 

Mohammad owns a small mini-market in his town. He has clients from his town and all over the neighboring villages. He’s well known for being kind and friendly with his clients even though they are visiting him for the first time. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. In that way he will be able to diversify his items, therefore increase his sales and thus respond rapidly to his client’s demands whatever they are. One of Mohammad’s greatest dreams is to offer his children a great life and see them achieving higher positions.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market

loans.name: Olivera

texts.en:
Olivera is forty-one years old and lives in a minority community of Kosovo. She is a mother of two boys, ages six and eight years old.  The older boy is currently attending school. Olivera’s husband works as a police officer, and she is a housewife who loves her children very much and is taking care of them. For a long time they have lived in an old house.  A few years ago they were able to start building a new house but they could only finish one room, not the whole house. Olivera always wanted to have pleasant atmosphere to raise her children and had really wanted to finish the entire house to live in but they don t have enough money. 

Olivera is asking for 1.500 Euro loan in order to buy material to finish the rooms and buy windows and doors to complete the house. This loan will help them to complete their home and dreams and enjoy better living conditions.  Thay are very happy for this support and appreciate all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy material to finish the rooms and buy windows and doors

loans.name: Tobiko

texts.en:
Tobiko is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES. 40,000. 

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES. 80,000 from KADET LTD , with which he intends to purchase farm inputs for use in his farm for better yields.  The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man, who has been working in transportation for three years. Mohamad didn't finish his elementary education because his parents couldn't afford paying for his tuition fees, which forced him to work early in order to help his parents in covering their expenses.
Mohamad started his own business a year ago, and he is working hard to improve it. His van needs maintenance.  He has to change its engine, so he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua.  He is specialized in transporting students from and to school. The only obstacle he has faced was the high price of fuel in Lebanon.
Mohamad is planning to improve and expand his business as much as he can, to improve his income and his living.

loans.use: to change his van's engine

loans.name: Nyamiryango Wns Group

texts.en:
Magret is a 47-year-old, hardworking woman with six children. She and her family live in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children to the university level. 

Magret has been a farmer for 20 years. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to venture into modern farming methods. She also has a vision of diversifying her business to new areas. 

Magret intends to use the loan to pay workers to mulch her garden. She is a member of the abovementioned group where each member guarantees to support one another.

loans.use: to pay workers to mulch her garden.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Pamela works hard to support her family.

Pamela has a business selling copra (dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut) in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from frozen foods and pig fattening. Pamela is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more copra to sell.

Pamela has been able to sustain her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building her business and securing the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more copra (dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut) and sell.

loans.name: Lynette

texts.en:
Lynette is 34 years old and married with four children.

Lynette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Lynette has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling rice.

Lynette aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 45-year-old man. He’s married to Amina, a wonderful lady and the mother of three working children. Since their marriage, Youssef used to work under pressure, trying his best to bring added income to the family and enrich their life. 

Youssef has been working as a blacksmith since a few years ago. He owns a shop where he manufactures different types of metal upon request. He learned this profession through experience and doing the best he can to better improve and develop himself. As he wants to enlarge his business and grow his work as well, he decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way. He wishes to take more and bigger projects to amplify his income and be able to make the needed savings for his future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase the needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a 55-year-old, single mother of four children who are over 18 years old. Elina sells grocery goods, a business she started two years ago and earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She has requested a second loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fruits, vegetables and two bags of maize. The profit she earns will be put back into her business. 

Elina dreams of seeing her children reach higher levels of education as well as prosperity in her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits and two bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a one of the few women who do not fully rely on their spouses for their personal expenses. She is always on the lookout for new business opportunities. Thanks to her efforts and the support she gets from Yehu and Kiva, she has been able to progress in life. Bahati says that since the previous loans, her living standards have improved. She needs a loan to invest in her current business. Since the previous loan enabled her to have a business location, she was able to include the sale of more household items. She is taking out this loan to buy cereals, sacks of sugar, tea leaves, etc. This way she will continue to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sack of sugar, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Kesue

texts.en:
Kesue is 35 years old. He is married to Ireen, and together they have two children that he supports. He has run a butchery for the last four years, getting a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has applied for a business loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more animals for slaughter and add the stock of meat to his shop for sale.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. His future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Patricia Ofelia

texts.es: La socia Ofelia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 50  años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos. La socia Ofelia se dedica a elaborar postres, pasteles y tortas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos por ejemplo harina, leche, huevos, margarina y otras cosas más. La socia Ofelia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Andes” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en: Ofelia was born in the city of Cusco and lives in the same city where she was born. She is fifty years old and married, and from this beautiful relationship she has three children. Ofelia works making desserts, pastries, and cakes. She's already been in this business for several years and it's going very well for her. On this occasion she needs a loan to buy supplies, for example flour, milk, eggs, margarine, and other things. Ofelia belongs to the communal bank "Los Andes," in the Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy supplies, for example flour, milk, eggs, margarine, and other things.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with three children whom they support. 

Margaret has been running a fruit and vegetable stall in Narok for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has applied for a business loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD so she can buy more assorted fruits and vegetables.

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to expand her fruit and vegetable stall.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell for her business.

Marialyn has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Sharhuu

texts.en: Mr.Sharkhuu lives with his wife and four children in a Ger of Tosontsengel province. He is 37 years old. He has been working at a Mongolian national boots company since 2009. He also produces a small amount at home during his free time and sells them in the center of the province and throughout the countryside by order. He has already gained alot of experience and potential customers' trust in this area. His wife helps his business. His estimated monthly profit will be between 250,000-350,000 MNT. He is planning to purchase a car to distribute products throughout the countryside. Mr.Sharkhuu is requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase raw materials for traditional boots. He is a welcoming and reticent man who also has experience in furniture-making, and he has a dream of having a furniture-making business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for traditional boots

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en:
Zorica is a 20-year-old woman who lives in one of the vulnerable ethnic minority communities in Kosovo. She is a young mother with two children, ages 6 months and 2 years. She is a stay-at-home mother. Her husband works as a technical staff member in a primary school. They live in a small village under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. 

They are in urgent need to do some renovations to their house before the winter. Their house has not been repaired for a long time. Her house has a heat-loss problem due to poor insulation. Every winter it is very hard to keep the house warm, and her children always get sick due to the cold. For the first time, she is requesting a loan to renovate two rooms and also the bathroom in order to be ready before the winter. After repairing the house Zorica will be able to create normal living conditions for the family. Zorica appreciates the help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate rooms in her house before winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate one room of her home and buy furniture

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 40 years old, married, and a father of two children. For the last seven years, Erick has been earning a living by operating a garage business in Malindi, getting a monthly income of about KES 25,000.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of KES 100,000. He intends to buy additional equipment such as drills and welding machines needed for his business. 

Erick will save the anticipated profit, take care of his family, and pay the school fees for his two sons as he continues to grow his business. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and also venture into other investments.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment such as drills and welding machines needed for his business

loans.name: Emilienne Sonagnon

texts.fr: Emilienne Sonagnon est âgée 41ans, mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle vend des tissus et des séries de bol depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est essentiellement composée des semi grossistes et des détaillants. En vue d'agrandir son fonds de commerce et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev. Ce concours financier lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'achever la construction de sa maison.
texts.en: Emilienne Sonagnon is 41 years old. She is married and has one child in school. She has  been selling fabric and sets of bowls for some years. She stocks up at one of the Benin markets. Her large and diverse customer base is mainly composed of semi-wholesalers and retailers. With the goal of expanding her working capital and meeting customer demand, she has requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This support will allow her to help pay for the education of her [child] and  finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of fabric and five sets of bowls.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия обратилась в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой, ей необходимо провести дома ремонт.   Она хочет утеплить комнаты , потому что наступают холода.   Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации и каждый раз присылает деньги.   Также сама Зульфия работает воспитательницей в детском саду, но накопленные средства недостаточны для проведения ремонта  и утепления комнат. Для этого она просит кредит чтобы провести косметический ремонт и построить печь с удобной стороны. Она надеется на поддержку  Арванд, и ее семья думает что эту зиму они проживут в тепле и уюте.
texts.en: Zulfiya came to MDO "Arvand" for financial support because she needs to make repairs at home.  She wants to insulate rooms because the cold season is coming.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation and sends money every time.  Also, Zulfiya works as an instructor at a kindergarten, but her savings are not enough to make repairs and insulate the rooms.  She is requesting this loan to make cosmetic repairs and build a heater from a convenient side.  Zulfiya relies on the support from Arvand, and her family thinks that they will spend this winter in warmth and comfort.

loans.use: to make home repairs and insulate rooms for the winter

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким родился в 1963 году в городе Исфара. Женат, имеет 4-х детей. С 2005 года является активным клиентом, первый раз получил кредит в размере 500 сомони для увеличения оборотных средств. С тех пор он постоянно берет кредит, потому что таким образом может осуществить свои планы.  Муким  занимается купля-продажей риса.  Это его единственный доход в семье. На полученный кредит хочет закупить несколько мешков риса. Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mukim was born in 1963 in the city of Isfara.  He is married and has four children.  He has been an active client since 2005 and obtained his first loan in the amount of 500 somoni to increase his working capital.  Since then, he has been regularly obtaining loans because this is how he is able to realize his plans.  Mukim is involved in buying and selling rice.  This is his sole source of income in the family.  He wants to use this loan to purchase several bags of rice.  He thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of rice

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса живет в Новой Каховке. Она торгует на одном из местных рынков, арендуя землю под торговое место у администрации. Лариса торгует клееночной продукцией, москитными сетками, скатертями, салфетками. 
Лариса планирует вложить кредит в размере 21 000 гривен в закупку клееночной продукции, а именно, скатертей, салфеток и т.д. Она хочет съездить за товаром на оптовую базу, где все это можно приобрести по оптовым ценам. Лариса настроена продолжать заниматься бизнесом, нарабатывать клиентскую базу дальше.
texts.en: Larisa lives in Novaya Kahovka.  She sells at one of the local markets and leases her retail outlet land from the administration.  Larisa sells vinyl products, mosquito nets, table cloths and napkins.  She plans to invest the loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia to purchase vinyl products, specifically table cloths, napkins, etc.  She wants to travel for the merchandise to a wholesale depot, where all of this can be purchase at wholesale prices.  Larisa intends to continue running this business and building her customer base further.

loans.use: to purchase vinyl products, specifically table cloths, napkins, etc

loans.name: Sporah

texts.en:
Sporah is 32 years old, married to David and blessed with two children that she supports. She operates a mobile phone accessories shop in Narok Town, and makes a good income.

She has applied for KES 30,000 from KADET LTD.  It will facilitate her buying more cell phone accessories for sale.  The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. 

Sporah's future dream is to have a stable business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories for sale.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна продолжает развивать свое дело в родном Дрогобыче. Товар хорошо реализуется, бизнес приносит ей хороший стабильный доход. 
В этот раз Татьяна обратилась в КИВА за кредитом суммой в 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию товара для нового сезона, увеличив его ассортимент.
texts.en: Tatyana continues to develop her business in her native Drogobych.  The merchandise sells well, and the business brings her a good, stable income.  This time, Tatyana came to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia to purchase an inventory of merchandise for the new season and expand her selection.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of merchandise for the new season and expand her selection

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира жительница района Бохтар. Ей 35 лет. Она живет с мужем. У нее трое детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Мунира работает на рынке "Хочи Шариф". Она занимается торговлей детской и женской одежды. В этой области Мунира четыре года. Она в первый раз кредитуется в нашей организации. Мунира берет кредит для приобретения сезонного товара с целью увеличения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en: Munira is a resident of the Bohtar district.  She is 35 years old.  She lives with her husband and has three children, all of whom attend a school.  Munira works at a market, called "Hochi Sharif."  She sells children's and women's clothing.  Munira has been in this business for four years.  This is her first time obtaining financing from our organization.  Munira is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise in order to expand the selection of her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase warm children's clothing and women's and men's hats

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 34, is a businesswoman in Mtopanga, Mombasa. She is married to Eliud, and they are blessed with three children, ages 15, six and four. She sells sports equipment to her customers, a business she has engaged in successfully for the past seven years.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sporting shoes, games kits for school children and balls to sell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and also to provide for the basic needs of her family. She hopes to have many sales outlets.

loans.use: to purchase more sporting shoes, games kits for school children and balls to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married to Raphael, and blessed with two children that she supports. She has operated a beauty shop and salon in Narok, Kenya for the past two years. Her monthly income is KES 30,000 

She has applied for a business loan of KES. 50,000 from KADET LTD which shewill  use to purchase beauty products and hire an extra person in her busy beauty salon.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her future dreams is to have a stable business and construct rental houses.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for sale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 41-year-old, married woman. She started her business of raising animals and selling them 20 years ago. There are thirteen members of her family. Her husband is gardener at a school and looks after the school garden. Her one son is running business of games. Despite these activities, their income is not sufficient to meet with the daily expenses of the family. She is contributing a lot to the family income through all her hard work and devotion. She buys small animals at lower rates and then looks after them and resells them at higher rates near the occasion of Eid-ul-azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She earns good profit through this business.

She is a mother of nine children.  Among them, one is married and two daughters and three sons are going to school. She is liable to provide their family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothing, and education. She needs to grow her business so she applied for a loan of RS 20,000 from Kashf to invest in buying small animals and feed for them. She is hopeful to see an increase in her income and desires to spend part of the profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: To buy small animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tractor rent and labor to dig a water channel.

loans.name: Humbat

texts.en:
Humbat is a 53 year old man who lives in IDP Settlement with his wife and four children.  He is a farmer and raises crops. He has 18 years of experience in this field.  His son helps him to run the business. Humbat has permanent customers for selling crops to, and his monthly income is 100 AZN. 

The  IDP Settlement where Humbat lives is newly built by the government, and is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan where there are very rigorous climate conditions. In summer, the temperature reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit.  The main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for animals. 

Humbat is not able to a build a water channel for his garden alone. This is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.  He was extremely excited about water loans provided by AqroInvest, and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment, like a tractor, for making a water channel and to pay for workers who will dig the land.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment to dig a channel and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 48-year-old married woman. She is an energetic woman, and she has sold clothing for the past one year. Her husband is employed in a mill, but his income is unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

This has forced Iqbal to initiate her own business to contribute to the family income. She does well in her community by offering different colors of cloths, considering each customer’s demand and choice.

Her collection is famous in her town. She makes enough to lead a decent life.  However these days she is facing the difficulty of low cash in hand, so she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her friend.  She has applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a greater variety of clothes as her customer base is varied and diverse. 

In addition to repaying the loan, Iqbal will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Diana Mercedes

texts.es: Diana tiene 26 años estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años, empezó el negocio de ser comerciante por influencia de sus amigas ya que ella vio que sus amigas tenían este negocio y le iba muy bien pues ella quiso tomar los mismos pasos y ser comerciante de ropa , pues ese es su trabajo en la actualidad con la ayuda del préstamo del banco D-MIRO .Ella comprara pantalones , almohada , blusas , shorts etc.
texts.en: Diana, 26, is single and has a two-years-old son.  She started being a merchant influenced by her girlfriends because she saw that they were in this business and did well so she wanted to take the same path and become a clothes merchant.  This is her current occupation and she does it with the help of loans from D-Miro Bank.  She will buy pants, pillows, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.use: to buy pants, pillows, blouses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 43-year-old man who is engaged in farming. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in an IDP settlement with his wife and two children. He has raised vegetables like potato, carrot, and pumpkins in his garden for the last 10 years. He also breeds cattle for meat purposes. Both businesses bring him a stable income of 250 AZN. However, there is a problem which prevents growing his business--shortage of water resources for animals and for irrigation. 

The IDP settlement was built several years ago and there are still some utility problems with the water supply. People are suffering and he has to order special cars with water to irrigate his crops, especially in summertime, when the temperature reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Building a water channel requires a lot of expense and is a expensive process which requires labor force and special equipment.  When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment like tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land.

loans.use: to pay for tractor rent and hire labor for digging water channel

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who is 27 years old, is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She owns a kiosk in which she sells basic household goods, like salt, tissue paper, and other products for daily consumption and at the same time for daily use at home.

Catherine has to work hard every day in order to progress.  Thanks to this business, she is able to contribute to the well being of her home. This is why she really wishes to obtain a credit with Yehu, in order to be able to buy a larger amount of products for her kiosk, such as wheat and maize flour, sugar, baked products, salt, etc. 

This way, she hopes to see her kiosk growing and having a more stable business, which brings the kind of tranquility Catherine wishes for her old age.

loans.use: to buy more products for her kiosk, such as wheat and maize flour, sugar, baked products, and salt.

loans.name: Greta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora,ella enseña a los diferentes colegios,la socia tambien se dedica a prestar dinero a las diferentes personas que lo necesitan,la socia trabaja como profesora desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,su sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde venden juguetes.La socia solicita le credito para uso personal para comprar un televisor.

La socia esta contenta con el credito naterior y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working as a teacher.  She teaches in several schools.  She also lends money to people who need it.  She works as a teacher from 8am until 6pm and she’s been in this occupation for 8 years and does very well.  Her dream is to have a toy store.  She’s requesting a personal use loan to buy a television set.  She was happy with the previous loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue en su carrera de enseñanza de nivel primaria,la socia le gustaria tener una tienda donde vende ropa,la socia por medio de su trabajo quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para implementar su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues with her career as an elementary school teacher.  She’d like to have a clothing store.  She wants to get ahead by means of her work.  She’s requesting a loan to buy sound equipment for her house.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her house.

loans.name: Carmen Felicidad

texts.es: Carmen tiene 55 años estado civil viuda tiene hijos mayores de edad. Carmen comenzó por causa de la falta de empleo que posee el país y no podía encontrar un trabajo fijo por su edad .Carmen tomo  el rumbo de ser una comerciante más del país. Pero uno de sus mayores impedimentos es la  falta de capital, pues lo que  ella vende  es  ropa. Ella levanta a las 6:00am y comienza su recorrido a dejar mercadería a sus clientes. Con el préstamo Carmen va a comprar: abrigos, blusas, pantalones, camisetas  vestidos etc.
texts.en: Carmen, 55, is a widow and has adult children.  She started out because of the lack of employment in the country and not being able to get a steady job at her age.  Carmen decided to become one more merchant in the country.  But one of her greatest impediments is lack of capital because what she sells is clothes.  She rises at 6am and starts her route delivering merchandise to her customers.  Carmen will use the loan to buy coats, blouses, pants, T-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.use: to buy coats, blouses, pants, T-shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el Progreso esta conformado por 8 integrantes, 6 mujeres y 2 hombres. En las edades comprendidas de 30 a 65 anos de edad. Con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes pertenecen al municipio de Sauce lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte de país. Los integrantes del banco se han caracterizado por ser personas responsables, buena paga.  En los  créditos anteriores han cumplido en tiempo y forma. Francis Betania es la coordinadora del banco comunal el Progreso la que se encarga de la responsabilidad del grupo. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de forma ambulante. La rutina de Francis es salir a las calle desde muy temprano a ofrecer su producto a clientes fijos y eventuales. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en comprar y venta e cuajada. El banco comunal el Progreso agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escaso recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank has 8 members; six women and two men.  Their ages range from 30 to 65 and they have ten children in their care.  These members are all from Sucre, a place located in the northern part of the country.  The bank members have stood out for being responsible people who are good payers.  They have repaid their previous loans properly and on time.

Francis Betania is the El Progreso group coordinator; she’s in charge of making sure the group is responsible.  Her economic activity is selling milk curd from place to place.  Francis’ routine is to head out into the streets starting very early to sell her product to both regular and occasional customers.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy and sell milk curd.

The El Progreso communal bank is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy and sell milk curd.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old, married and a mother of three children. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 8,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 to buy farm supplies needed for her business. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as to expand her farming activities. 

Her goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing her income so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gani

texts.en:
Gani is a sixty-two year old male who is married and has one child. He lives in a northern part of Kosovo. Gani used to work in administration for a long time. Gani’s  job is the family’s main source of income. 
His house has not had any repairs for long time and he has wanted to do general renovations but only recently has been able to manage to save the money. 
Gani has asked for a loan to continue renovation to change the windows and doors, install a new water system and to façade the house. 
The loan will help him realize his goals and have better living conditions in the future for his family. 

Gani appreciates all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To do renovation to change the windows, doors, install a new water system and to façade the house

loans.name: Gs Libertad Choluteca No.1 Group

texts.es:
Doña Macaria es una Señora muy honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en el centro de Choluteca, Honduras. Su negocio es una glorieta y la venta de leña.
Doña Macaria el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de leña, refrescos. Con el préstamo ella espera tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes y con ello aumentar las ventas ya que los clientes siempre encuentran lo que necesitan y con esto mejorara el estilo de vida en la familia al incrementar los ingresos en el hogar.
En el futuro Doña Macaria sueña con que su glorieta se convierta en un pequeño restaurante al igual que seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que continúen sus estudios en la universidad y tengan mejores oportunidades en  el futuro.
Don Mamerto tiene 65 años de edad su negocio es la venta de pan actividad que realiza desde ya hace 20 años en los barrios cercanos a su casa.
Don Oscar tiene 48 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de pan actividad que realiza desde ya hase15 años en los barrios aledaños a su casa.
Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Macaria is a very honest woman.  She is responsible, hardworking, and lives with her husband and two children in the center of Choluteca, Honduras.  She has a small grocery store and sells firewood. 

Macaraia needs this loan to purchase firewood and beverages.  With this loan she hopes to have more products to offer her customers thus improving sales as her customers aways find what they need.  By doing this she will improve her family's lifestyle and will increase her household income.  

In the future, Macaria dreams of converting her small store into a small restaurant so she can continue to support her children in their studies at university so they have better opportunities in the future. 

Mamerto is 65 years old.  He makes a living selling bread and has been doing this for the last 20 years in the nearby neigborhoods.  

Oscar is 48 years old.  His business is also selling bread to neighboring villages.  He has been doing this for the last 15 years.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and firewood for their business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 55-year-old married man and father of three children. In 1990, Mohamad opened a grocery store to make his living, and he loves his business and is working hard to improve it.
Mohamad used to work as an accountant, but just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon, his working opportunities are nonexistent, so the grocery store was the easiest and fastest business to cover his family's needs and expenses.
Mohamad applied for a loan from KIva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business merchandise with special cereals requested for winter, drinks and conservatives. He also hopes to open a larger shop in the future that might turn into a supermarket.
This is Mohamad's second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower,.  He has a good payback history.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special winter requested cereals, drink and conservatives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses

loans.name: Jad

texts.en:
Jad is 22-years old and single. He is a car's electrician in Jib Jennine, which he has been doing for six years.  In 2009,.he opened his own garage.

Jad is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy a pick up truck needed for his business. He will use it to transport hardware, spare parts, and other necessary equipment and machines.

Jad did not finish his Intermediate education, because of his parents' financial situation. He wished he had, but he hopes to develop his business to prevent his future children from experiencing his difficult childhood.  Jad hopes to develop his shop and start selling car accessories in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a pick up truck.

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en: Amrah is a student.  He is stufdying for an MBA at Western University, one of the most popular and expensive universities in the country.  He finishes next year. He is single and lives with his parents. His father has paid for his education. However, the financial situation has changed and now Amrah has to pay for his education alone.  He has applied for 2000 AZN loan to pay for his last year of education.

loans.use: to pay his MBA last year study

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
For cultural reasons, Yasmeen prefers that her photo not be on the Internet.  Thus the photo is of her husband. 
Yasmeen is a 28 year old young woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Yasmeen's husband wants to buy a taxi and use it to take customers' requests.  It will be another source of income to the family and help them to improve their living conditions.
Yasmeen wants to share with her husband in purchasing the taxi, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. Taking this loan will enable Yasmeen's husband to have his own project, which will be a profitable one and will lead to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a taxi

loans.name: Marium

texts.en:
Marium is a 28-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of embroidery by hand. She started doing work with her mother 15 years ago. She continued her work even after her marriage, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to bear the expenses of the family members. She is passionate about her work; her embroidery patterns are very popular in her town. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of one child and motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including the best quality food, clothes, and health. 

In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery, she needs to engage some more women. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles, and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Raquel es una señora que le gusta trabajar y luchar por su familia. Con 44 años de edad ella esta casada y vive en Sololá con su esposo  y sus 10 hijos. De ellos 6 varones y 4 mujeres, y 1 de ellos esta casado, 4 estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y los otros 5  apoyan en la agricultura. 
Ella se dedica a la agricultura conjuntamente con su esposo, cultivando papa, zanahoria rábano, apio y alverja esto lo cultiva cerca de su vivienda y en otros terrenos a pocos quilómetros. 
Este trabajo  lo aprendió  junto a sus padres desde que tenia 8 años ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en una escuela, ahora lleva 25 años de cultivar estas verduras, ya que  mantienen sus precios en el mercado teniendo mejores ganancias. 
De esta manera ve la necesidad de invertir y aprovechar el terreno que ella y el esposo tienen, solicitando un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para comprar semilla de papa y zanahoria así como su abono orgánico para luego cultivarlo. 
Entre sus metas junto a su esposo  quieren construir una casa para luego emprender otro negocio en un futuro.
texts.en:
Raquel is a woman who likes to work and strive for her family.  She’s 44-years-old, married and living in Sololá with her husband and ten children; six boys and four girls.  One of them is married; four attend school and the other five help with the agriculture work.  She and her husband work in agriculture growing potatoes, carrots, radishes, celery and peas.  She grows all this on land near her house and on other land located a few kilometers away.

She learned this work alongside her parents since she was 8-years-old so she never went to school.  She now has 25 years’ experience growing these vegetables since they retain their market price and produce better profits.

She needs once again to invest and take advantage of the land she and her husband have.  She’s requesting a 6,000 Quetzal loan to buy potato and carrot seeds as well as organic manure to then cultivate it.  Among her and her husband’s goals is to build a house and start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy potato and carrot seeds.

loans.name: Medoto Jeanne

texts.fr: Agée de 43ans, Medoto Jeanne est mariée et mère de 03 enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 20ans et 12ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des tissus, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Aged 43, Medoto Jeanne is married and mother of three children who go to school. The oldest and the youngest are respectively 20 and 12 years old. Her speciality is textiles and she buys her stock at one of the markets in Benin. Hoping to increase her turnover and satisfy the expectations of her clients, she requests a micro credit from Finadev in order to optimise her profits and participate in the cost of education for her children

loans.use: to buy 25 pieces of cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of applying for master's program in biomedical engineering

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Elida  es una señorita de 18 años de edad, soltera  viven junto a sus padres en Sololá. Graduada de profesión maestra de educación infantil. Una mujer joven trabajadora que desea superarse económicamente  con su familia.
Ella se dedica actualmente a la producción de Hongos ostra (Pleurotus Ostreatus), con el apoyo de sus padres son los que le dan el mantenimiento a esta producción. 
Ahora tiene 7 años de realizar esta actividad la cual aprendieron con sus padres  cuando aun estudiaba. Por el mismo deseo de superar las condiciones de vida de la familia ya que es hija única y tiene el deseo de apoyar a sus padres.   
Ella ve que la producción de los hongos ostra ha tenido buenos resultados la cual desea producir más y tener mejores ganancias,  de este modo solicita un crédito de Q 5,500.00 quetzales para la compra de un estante de madera y micelio de hongo para su producción. 
 Sus mayores sueños  es que para un futuro no muy lejano con los ingresos y las ganancias de este negocio seguir ampliando esta producción mejorando las ganancias y las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elida, 18, is a young, single woman living with her parents in Sololá.  She graduated as an early education teacher.  She’s a young, hardworking woman who wants to improve economically with her family.

She is currently producing oyster mushrooms (Pleurotus ostreatus) with help from her parents who are the ones that care for the production.  She’s been in this activity for 7 years having learned it from her parents while she was studying motivated by this same desire to improve her family’s living conditions since she’s an only daughter and wants to support her parents.

She’s noted that mushroom production is having good results and she wants to increase production to earn higher profits which is why she’s requesting a 5,500 Quetzal loan to buy wooden shelving and mushroom mycelium for its production.  

Her greatest dream is to use income and profits from this business in the not too distant future to continue expanding production and improving profits and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wooden shelving and mushroom mycelium.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is a 58-year-old man who is married with two daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a cattle breeder and has two cows. His monthly income is 300 AZN and this is only one financial income in his family. The area where he lives has very rigorous climate conditions and one problem, which is water, always exists. He has only one wish now--to connect water to his house. Now, to water his cows he pastures them to about one kilometer to the nearest river. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. Creating a water channel is quite an expensive process that requires labor force and special equipment. He will use this loan to pay for renting special equipment, like a tractor, for making the water channel and for workers who will dig the land.

loans.use: to pay tractor rent and hire labors to dig a water channel

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Judith, ella pertenece al banco “LUZ DEL SUR” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia es soltera y es madre de 2 niños,  Judith se sigue dedicando a la fabricación y mantenimiento de equipos de refrigeración. Judith en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar material como planchas de acero inoxidable, varillas de acero y motores de refrigeración. para la fabricación de sus maquinas frigoríficas.
Judith está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle fortalecerse en su actividad económica y por permitirle educar a sus hijos con sus ingresos económicos producto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The member Judith belongs to the bank "Luz del Sur" of the city of Cusco - Peru. The member is single and is the mother of two children. Judith is still devoted to the manufacture and maintenance of refrigeration equipment.

This time, Judith needs the loan to buy material such as stainless steel hotplates, steel rods, and refrigeration engines to manufacture refrigeration equipments. Judith is very grateful to Kiva because it helps her to strengthen her economic activity, and it allows her to educate her children with the income of her work.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel hotplates, steel rods and refrigeration engines.

loans.name: Henrry

texts.es:
El socio sigue trabajando en una mina de oro,el socio tambien sigue ayudando en el negocio de su madre que ella vende artesania como sombreros y sueteres,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio de venta de artesania,el sueño del socio es tener un local donde venda artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar sombreros y sueteres.

El socio esta contento con el credito anterior y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Henrry is still working in a gold mine, and also continues his work helping his mother with her small business selling artisan and craft products, such as woven hats and sweaters. Henrry has eight years of experience in the business, and his dream is to eventually open his own store where he can sell crafts and handiwork products.

Henrry is requesting this loan in order to purchase hats and sweaters for resale at the craft business. He is grateful for his previous loan, and promises to continue his good track record of prompt loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase hats and sweaters.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas.sombreros y muñecas,ella tiene un pusto donde vende artesania,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y tenr un local donde pueda vender la artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mantas,sombreros y muñecas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenaida continues her business selling crafts and artisan products, such as woven blankets, hats and dolls. She has a stand at a local market, and works from 8:00 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon. She now has eight years of experience in the business, and her dream is to expand and grow her business, eventually opening her own store where she can sell craft merchandise.

Zenaida is requesting this loan in order to purchase blankets, hats and dolls for resale at her stand. She is grateful for the previous loan, and promises to continue her good track record of prompt loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, hats and dolls.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en: Florah, 36, lives with her three children, two of whom are in school. She is a responsible woman, friendly and fully committed to whatever she is doing. She operates a produce sales business in the local market. She has operated the business for seven years and can rely on the loyal set of customers that she has gained in those years. She says that her hopes for the future are to grow her business and provide a decent life for herself and her family. She is applying for a Yehu loan that she will use to buy fruits and vegetables like onions, bananas, tomatoes, oranges, kales, etc., that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like onions, bananas, tomatoes, oranges, kales, etc.

loans.name: Lucia Cecilia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 48 años estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos. Lucia  comenzó con el negocio de la fabricación de ladrillos, lo empezó porque ya tenía conocimiento de cómo se elaboran los ladrillos .Ella sale a trabajar junto a su esposo de 6:00am hasta 15:00pm. Una de sus mayores dificultades es el mal clima. Con el préstamo ella comprara: tierra , leña, palmito etc.
texts.en: Lucía, 48, is married and has two children.  She started a brick manufacturing business because she already knew how bricks are made.  She and her husband head out to work from 6am until 3pm.  One of her greatest problems in bad weather. She will use the loan to buy clay, firewood, palm bark, etc.

loans.use: to buy brick-making supplies.

loans.name: Mawena Angèle's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 27ans, Mawena Angèle la responsable est mariée. Spécialisée dans la commercialisation des portables, des crédits et des fournitures scolaires depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'accroître son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt afin d'aider son mari dans la construction de leur maison. Mawena Angèle se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group consists of two members with joint liability. Mawena Angèle, age 27, is the group leader. She is on the left in the photo. She is a married woman who sells mobile phones, recharge cards, and school supplies. She has been in this line of work for a few years, and she buys her stock at a market in Bénin and on the foreign markets. 

To bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she obtained a loan from Finadev. This credit will allow her to maximize her investment and support her husband’s project to build their house.

loans.use: to buy five mobile phones, five recharge cards, and ten packs of 100-page notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a tractor rental and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Fatimah prefers that her photo not be posted on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband.

Fatimah is  23 years old, married and has one child. She is from Baqa'a in Jordan. She has requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses. Fatimah is planning to buy some furniture and electrical devices. She is looking forward to improving the living conditions of her family.

Since Fatimah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 32-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in furniture making for 15 years. In  2010, Ali opened his own workshop to improve his living conditions and to increase his income. Ali is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business resources with extra wood and cloth. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he has a good history paying back loans.
Ali's experience in this field has attracted new customers and increased his income. He is looking forward to expand his working zone to cover new villages in order to expand his business and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with extra wood and cloth.

loans.name: Kamuche

texts.en: Kamuche, 40, is a married mother of seven. She earns a living selling brooms, a business she has been doing for the past 10 years. She is a hardworking woman who struggles to achieve what she needs. One of her goals she had was to run a kiosk. With the little capital she has from her savings, she is requesting this loan to open a retail shop. Kamuche will be able to buy flour, rice, baked products, and sugar, among other basic commodities. This way, she is sure to provide her family a quality life through increased income.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, baked products, and sugar, among other basic commodities.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas,gorros,chompas y pantalones,la socia lleva a diferentes tiendas donde venden artesania,el socio se dedica a este negocio 8 años y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el credito para comprar mantas,gorras,chompas ,pantalones al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: He continues selling crafts.  He sells blankets, caps, sweaters and pants.  He takes merchandise to various stores that sell crafts.  He’s been in this business for 8 years and does very well.  His dream is to expand his crafts selling business.  He’s requesting the loan to buy blankets, caps, sweaters and pants at wholesale.  He’s happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy blankets, caps, sweaters and pants at wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca  tiene 43 años tiene 4 hijos ya todos independientes, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos desde electrodomésticos hasta sabanas visitando y entregando a puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que le hacen pedidos ella entrega sus productos a crédito, la Sra. Blanca vive en su domicilio que  se encuentra en la zona de Tarechis,  este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Blanca va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería,  ya que tiene muchos pedidos y así de esta  manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería, la Sra. Blanca enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de producto y sueña con ampliar su casa y su negocio, la Sra. Blanca se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43 years old, and has four grown children. She makes a living in retail sales, and offers a variety of products from home appliances to bedding, as she travels around selling products to her customers. Blanca does offer her customers various payment options, including plans for payments on credit. She lives in the zone of Tarechis, and this loan will be her first with this institution. Blanca plans to use the support from this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business, and she hopes that this investment will help her to fulfill more customer orders and increase her working capital.

Blanca faces challenges in managing her business, including changing customer demand. She plans to leverage the support from this loan to increase the variety of products she offers to customers, as well as to improve her customer service. Her dream is to expand and grow her business, and to make improvements to her home. Blanca is grateful for the support she has received, and for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business, including sheets and home appliances.
